core:process.core:comment: Cancel (return) one gift card and add its value to another. The replacement card can be a new card (re-issue) or an existing one (merge).

core:assignAction.core:comment: Sets properties on the cancelled gift card basket item.
Sets properties on the gift card basket item. TODO more to do here...

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: If 'new card' is not defined, prompt

core:assignAction.core:comment: Sets properties on the replacement gift card basket item.
Sets properties on the replacement gift card basket item.

core:executeProcessAction.core:comment: The value will be got from the authorisation response so this must succeed.

core:assignAction.core:comment: Set the value entered on the cancelled card item into the replacement item.
Set the value from the cancelled card authorisation response.

core:executeProcessAction.core:comment: Reverses the authorisation and adds the item and a voided item pair to the basket.

core:assignAction.core:comment: Set the same reference on both basket items

core:executeProcessAction.core:comment: Reverses the authorisation (if necessary) and adds the item and a voided item pair to the basket.

core:action.core:comment: Set the replacement item as a child of the cancelled item. The idea is to force them to be voided as a pair.

core:executeProcessAction.core:comment: Validate the replacement card. Update is left to the end transaction.

core:assignAction.core:comment: Set the name and address on the basket from the cancelled card response. It's the only way to get it across onto the new card because it's not stored in the item.

core:action.core:comment: Test if the cancelled card had a name and address and if so there is no name and address currently on the transaction.

core:state.core:comment: Although the type may be different, we require the acquirer to be the same for both cards.
If no Acquirer is defined we can't process online, so allow them to enter the value?

core:promptState.core:comment: Authorisation Declined. Outcome may give the reason.
Authorisation Declined. Outcome may give the reason.

core:state.core:comment: If the replacement item authorisation fails or we cancel for any reason we must now reverse the cancelled card authorisation.
If we cancel or fail at the final stage we must reverse both the replacement and the cancelled card authorisation.

core:messageState.core:comment: New card was authorised but is already issued. Continue only if user has authorisation.
